channel.title: Tech on Luke M. Perez, Ph.D.
channel.description: Recent content in Tech on Luke M. Perez, Ph.D.

item.title: Github in 2022 and Beyond
item.description: This is more a place-mark for myself when I invariably need to re-source the tutorials. Halfway through 2021, Github changed how users interact with the service in the command line. Instead of authenticating through a username and password, users must now use a Personal Access Token. The upsides in the aggregate are plenty, but mostly centering on better security for everyone. The downside, for infrequent users of Github are that I need to update all my repos.
